result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all Court costs, fines, surcharges and/ or restitution, to be paid through collection by the DOC from25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision in case 14CF4817.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence.
Conditions of Extended Supervision in 14CF4817 to apply.
AS a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm or body armor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Jeff Cloyd Jr.

defendant.name: Cloyd, Terrence Jeff, Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 12/22/2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF4817 (60 Pages).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional staetments by Dajuanna T and Cynthia S.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision in case# 14CF4817:
- Attend and successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" program.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Mental Health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Take ALL prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Successfully complete anger management class.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with: Dajuanna T and Cynthia S until Batterers Intervention is completed.  3rd party contact for time with children as approved by the agent.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all applicable child support.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero;
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA, Domestic Violence and Victim Witness); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision (case# 14CF4817). DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted person of a domestic violence offense he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 2:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant now has a new felony case (2014CF4817).  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 12-22-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Counsel informed the Court that case 2014CF1120 is scheduled for a Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  Defendant has another case, with a different victim, scheduled for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 11-5-2014 at 8:30 am.   On 11-3-2014, the State will move to Adjourn the Jury Trial, based on a new case to be issued for defendant.  Therefore, the Jury Trial dates for both cases will be changed to a Status Conference in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 11-5-2014 at 8:30 am on case 2014CM1633.   mld

Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defendant has another case; 2014CM1633 with a different victim.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Evan Glaberson appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.
 Upon the request of ADA Heitman, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-16-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered that the no contact order is continued and no violations of the law.   mld

Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to all charges.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference to Branch 4 on 6-25-2014 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail, including the no contact order, and no weapons are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cynthia S. and Corisse C.

Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Defendant Terrence Jeff Cloyd in custody.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant withholds plea as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
Defendant has retained private counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
